page.title: 03CHANGING TIMES OF CARTERTON
page.content: We talked to three generations of one family to discover their separate views of Carterton. The grandmother remembers the{rural character}of the village in the{1920's.}There were a few shops then but no other amenities. Lack of public transport particularly seems to have helped a strong community spirit to develop. Concert parties,harvest suppers and the annual flower show were part of the home spun entertainment. She feels that the arrival of the airfield caused{'the {break up of Carterton'.}Her daughter grew up with the airfield alongside the village and doesn't feel that the character changed until the 50's.She welcomes the{new shops}and is a member of 3 of the{many clubs}but regrets the anonymity of the larger town. The youngest member preferred further growth, especially a{sports centre.
